content: We update using GitHub Actions to automatically run actions on the page and print the result here. Remember that you can study overnight in some libraries. For overnight information, visit https://www.lib.berkeley.edu/hours and pay attention that they are displayed in the form like ‘8 a.m. - 6 a.m.’, which means it opens till 6 a.m. next morning. These kinds of information are listed in the details of a library’s opening hours details and you need to click on the library to see them, which also makes Python Web Scraper a bit complex to do (so this feature is not integrated here :D). ============================================================ UC Berkeley Library Open Status Last Update: 2026-02-02 02:10:56 PST Data Source: https://www.lib.berkeley.edu/hours ============================================================ Now Open (0)ï¼š (None) Now Closed (22)ï¼š ğŸ”´ Art History/Classics Library ğŸ”´ Bancroft Library ğŸ”´ Berkeley Law Library ğŸ”´ Bioscience, Natural Resources & Public Health Library ğŸ”´ Business Library ğŸ”´ Chemistry, Astronomy & Physics Library ğŸ”´ Doe Library ğŸ”´ East Asian Library ğŸ”´ Engineering & Mathematical Sciences Library ğŸ”´ Environmental Design Library ğŸ”´ Ethnic Studies Library ğŸ”´ Graduate Services (study only) ğŸ”´ Institute of Governmental Studies Library ğŸ”´ Institute of Transportation Studies Library ğŸ”´ Main (Gardner) Stacks ... and other 7 libraries are closed. Status Unknown (5)ï¼š âšª Print + scan âšª Berkeley Art Museum and Pacific Film Archive âšª Environmental Design Archives âšª Graduate Theological Union Library âšª Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory Library ============================================================
summary: Show the latest opening status of all UC Berkeley Libraries.
title: UC Berkeley Library Time Check

content:
Last Updated
2026.01.02
Status
Maintaining.
SudoSodoku is a minimalist, keyboard-centric (conceptually) puzzle game that brings the Linux terminal aesthetic to your iPhone. It strips away the distractions of modern casual games, offering a raw, focus-driven environment powered by a robust algorithmic core.
ğŸ‰ v1.0.0 - First Official Release We are thrilled to announce the first stable release of SudoSodoku! This version represents a complete, polished game with all core features implemented and tested:
Procedural Puzzle Generation: Real-time generation of unique, solvable puzzles. Four Difficulty Levels: Easy, Medium, Hard, and Master with intelligent scoring. Pencil Mode: Toggle candidate notes for complex deduction strategies. Undo/Redo System: Full history stack for fearless experimentation. Smart Archives: Automatic saving with favorites and replay functionality. ELO Rating System: Competitive ranking from SCRIPT_KIDDIE to THE_ARCHITECT. Terminal Aesthetic: Authentic green phosphor UI with haptic feedback. Modular Architecture: Clean, maintainable codebase organized by feature. âœ¨ Features ğŸ–¥ï¸ Immersive Terminal Aesthetic Visuals: Authentic Green Phosphor (#00FF00) on Deep Dark Background (#0D121A). Feedback: “Juice” interaction model with UIImpactFeedbackGenerator providing mechanical-keyboard-like haptics for every input. Animations: Matrix-style victory effects and CRT-like glow pulses. â™¾ï¸ Infinite Procedural Generation Real-time Engine: Generates unique, solvable puzzles on-the-fly using a randomized Backtracking Algorithm. Human-like Grading: Difficulty is not determined by random holes, but by a Logical Solver that simulates human techniques (Naked Singles, Hidden Singles, etc.) to assign a precise difficulty score (0-100). ğŸ† Competitive ELO System Dynamic Rating: Starts at 1200 (USER). Beats puzzles to rank up. Adaptive K-Factor: Rating changes stabilize as you reach higher tiers (Master/Grandmaster). Anti-Smurfing: High-level players gain zero rating from solving low-level puzzles. Rank Titles: < 1200: SCRIPT_KIDDIE 1200 - 1400: USER … 2000+: THE_ARCHITECT ğŸ’¾ Robust Persistence Game Center Integration: Seamless, password-less login and user profile management. Cloud Sync: Leveraging iCloud Documents to sync game states and archives across devices (automatically degrades to local storage if iCloud is unavailable). JSON Serialization: All game records are stored as Codable JSON structs, ensuring backward compatibility and easy migration. ğŸ› ï¸ Technical Architecture SudoSodoku is built with modern iOS technologies, designed for maintainability and performance:
Language: Swift 5.9 UI Framework: SwiftUI (Apple’s modern declarative UI framework) Architecture: MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) pattern for clean code organization State Management: Reactive updates using Combine framework Data Persistence: Automatic cloud sync via iCloud (with local fallback) Safe file operations with atomic writes Backward-compatible data migration User Experience: Custom animations and haptic feedback for a polished feel Directory Structure SudoSodoku/ â”œâ”€â”€ Models/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ GameRecord.swift # Codable save data structure â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ SudokuCell.swift # Unit cell model â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ MoveHistory.swift # Move history for undo/redo â”‚ â””â”€â”€ Difficulty.swift # Enum with rating ranges â”œâ”€â”€ ViewModels/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ SudokuGame.swift # Core game logic & state machine â”œâ”€â”€ Managers/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ GameCenterManager.swift # GameKit authentication â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ RatingManager.swift # ELO calculation algorithms â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ HapticManager.swift # Haptic feedback engine â”‚ â””â”€â”€ StorageManager.swift # File I/O & Cloud syncing â”œâ”€â”€ Views/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ ContentView.swift # Main entry & NavigationStack â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ LandingView.swift # Landing page â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ GameView.swift # The game board â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ UserProfileView.swift # User profile & statistics â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ ArchiveView.swift # History & Favorites list â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ ModeSelectionView.swift # Difficulty selection â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ BoardView.swift # Sudoku board rendering â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ ControlPanelView.swift # Game controls (undo/redo/numpad) â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Components/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ TerminalBackground.swift # Terminal-style background â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ MatrixVictoryOverlay.swift # Victory animation â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ NoteGridView.swift # Note display grid â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ GridLinesOverlay.swift # Board grid lines â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ StatCard.swift # Statistics card component â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ RankRow.swift # Rank display row â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ RecordRow.swift # Archive record row â”‚ â””â”€â”€ Styles/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ BouncyButtonStyle.swift # Button animation style â””â”€â”€ Algorithms/ â””â”€â”€ SudokuGenerator.swift # Backtracking & Digging logic Resources ğŸ“‚ GitHub Repository:
https://github.com/kaiiiichen/SudoSodoku

content:
Last Updated
2025.12.16
Status
Updating.
Launched in 2025, SUSTech-Kai-Notes is a personal notes initiative motivated by Cambridge Notes. However, one should also lay emphasis on other course resources apart from course notes.
It mainly includes the course resources I ever used or collected during my study at SUSTech and also includes few courses I took at other universities, which are mostly for general study credits but worth giving it a try.
I accompany this special notes project with a Github wiki page, which reviews the project and helps you get directed to submodules within clicks.
Resources ğŸ“‚ GitHub Repository Wiki:
https://github.com/kaiiiichen/SUSTech-Kai-Notes/wiki
title: SUSTech-Kai-Notes
